Customizing the editor appearance with themes

# Getting Started

Stheno is an opinionated CodeMirror configuration that provides a powerful markdown editing experience out of the box.

## Installation

Install Stheno along with its peer dependencies:

```bash
npm install @yettoapp/stheno @codemirror/state @codemirror/view
```

## Basic Usage

Create an editor with the default configuration:

```typescript
import { EditorView } from "@codemirror/view";
import { EditorState } from "@codemirror/state";
import { getSthenoConfig, setupThemeListener } from "@yettoapp/stheno";

// Create the editor
const view = new EditorView({
  parent: document.getElementById("editor"),
  state: EditorState.create(getSthenoConfig("markdown")),
});

// Enable automatic dark/light mode switching based on system preference
setupThemeListener(view);
```

## What's Included

Out of the box, Stheno provides:

- **Full Markdown Support** - GitHub Flavored Markdown with tables, task lists, and more
- **YAML Frontmatter** - Parse and highlight frontmatter in your documents
- **Syntax Highlighting** - Beautiful, consistent highlighting for markdown and code blocks
- **Keyboard Shortcuts** - Familiar shortcuts for formatting (Cmd+B for bold, etc.)
- **Image Previews** - Inline decorations show image previews as you type
- **Theming** - Dark and light themes with system preference detection
- **History** - Undo/redo support
- **Autocomplete** - Language-aware completions

How to install Stheno and its framework wrappers

# Installation

Stheno is distributed as several packages to fit different use cases.

## Core Package

The core package provides the base CodeMirror configuration:

```bash
npm install @yettoapp/stheno @codemirror/state @codemirror/view
```

### Peer Dependencies

Stheno requires CodeMirror 6 as peer dependencies:

- `@codemirror/state` - Editor state management
- `@codemirror/view` - Editor view and DOM handling

## Framework Packages

Choose the package that matches your framework:

### React

```bash
npm install @yettoapp/stheno-react
```

The React package includes `@yettoapp/stheno` as a dependency, so you only need to install the CodeMirror peer dependencies:

```bash
npm install @yettoapp/stheno-react @codemirror/state @codemirror/view
```

### Vue

```bash
npm install @yettoapp/stheno-vue @codemirror/state @codemirror/view
```

### Svelte

```bash
npm install @yettoapp/stheno-svelte @codemirror/state @codemirror/view
```

## TypeScript Support

All packages include TypeScript declarations out of the box. No additional `@types/*` packages are needed.

## Browser Support

Stheno supports all modern browsers that CodeMirror 6 supports:

- Chrome (latest)
- Firefox (latest)
- Safari (latest)
- Edge (latest)

## CDN Usage

While not recommended for production, you can use Stheno via CDN for quick prototyping:

```html
<script type="module">
  import { EditorView } from "https://esm.sh/@codemirror/view";
  import { EditorState } from "https://esm.sh/@codemirror/state";
  import { getSthenoConfig } from "https://esm.sh/@yettoapp/stheno";

  const view = new EditorView({
    parent: document.getElementById("editor"),
    state: EditorState.create(getSthenoConfig("markdown")),
  });
</script>
```
